meanings.definition: A person or thing that peels.
meanings.sent1: My mom is the best peelers in the family; she can peel an apple in seconds.
meanings.sent2: The peelers at the market were selling freshly peeled oranges.
meanings.sent3: The little monkey thought he was the fastest peelers in the jungle.
meanings.sent4: The peelers of the onion revealed its layers of flavor.
meanings.sent5: The peelers in the kitchen drawer made cooking easier.

meanings.definition: A tool used for peeling fruits or vegetables.
meanings.sent1: I used the sharp peelers to peel the carrots for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen gadget drawer had various peelers for different fruits.
meanings.sent3: The peelers in the drawer were having a race to see who could peel the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The peeler in my hand effortlessly removed the skin from the apple.
meanings.sent5: The peeler's blade made quick work of the potato skins.

meanings.definition: A slang term for police officers.
meanings.sent1: The kids ran when they saw the peelers coming down the street.
meanings.sent2: The peelers patrolled the neighborhood to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The peelers were called to the scene of the missing cake mystery.
meanings.sent4: The peelers arrived just in time to stop the bank robbery.
meanings.sent5: The peelers kept a watchful eye on the city streets.
